title: Poem of Brutulus
body:
Transcript

As a mountain waits,

Until the deep earth wakes,

With wrath and anger,

It conjures fire and magma.


As a volcano trembles,

Unleashing flaming terror,

Even the bravest men will fly,

But all men will die.


And as Brutulus walks,

So does the Earth quake,

And as Brutulus roars,

So do his foes shake.


And as Brutulus fights,

With hammer and sword,

With thunder and lightning,

He conquers the world.
preface: The Poem of Brutulus is a short poem written about Brutulus.
